title: A novel EndMT inhibitor, xanthotoxin, attenuates non-alcoholic fatty liver disease by acting as TGFβR2 antagonist.
abstract: Endothelial-to-mesenchymal transition (EndMT) has emerged as a key process contributing to the pathology of non-alcoholic fatty liver disease (NAFLD). Thus, identifying EndMT inhibitors may help impede NAFLD progression.
journal: Phytomedicine : international journal of phytotherapy and phytopharmacology
